unnormalised: Hey folks, looks like this Diwali is gonna pinch the pocket a bit. News coming in hot from IOCL (Indian Oil Corporation Limited) is that your LPG cylinder just got a bit more expensive. Industry sources whisper of a Rs. 50 hike for the 14.2 kg domestic cylinder. Ouch!
normalised: Hey folks, looks like this Diwali is going to pinch the pocket a bit. News coming in hot from I O C L (Indian Oil Corporation Limited) is that your L P G cylinder just got a bit more expensive. Industry sources whisper of a rupee fifty hike for the fourteen point two kilogram domestic cylinder. Ouch!

unnormalised: Reports suggest that the price bump is mainly due to rising international crude oil prices. So, that aloo paratha you were planning to make for the extended family get-together might just cost a little more, eh? Dr. Sharma down the street was heard grumbling about it this morning near the Durga Puja pandal.
normalised: Reports suggest that the price bump is mainly due to rising international crude oil prices. So, that aloo paratha you were planning to make for the extended family get-together might just cost a little more, eh? Doctor Sharma down the street was heard grumbling about it this morning near the Durga Puja pandal.

unnormalised: Now, unsubsidized cylinders are hovering around Rs. 1100-1200 in Delhi and Mumbai. Many feel this will affect budgets, especially for families living in smaller flats (say, 500 sq ft) in congested areas like Chandni Chowk. Guess it's back to the drawing board for budget planning. Let's hope this doesn't keep climbing! Happy Diwali planning!
normalised: Now, unsubsidized cylinders are hovering around rupee one thousand one hundred to one thousand two hundred in Delhi and Mumbai. Many feel this will affect budgets, especially for families living in smaller flats (say, five hundred square feet) in congested areas like Chandni Chowk. Guess it's back to the drawing board for budget planning. Let's hope this doesn't keep climbing! Happy Diwali planning!
